title: Whiskeytown National Recreation Area: Reptiles
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Nature     Animals     Reptiles                Reptiles        Western pond turtle (Actinemys marmorata) NPS PHOTO    Lizards, snakes, and turtles can be seen throughout the park during Whiskeytown's warm summer months. Seven lizard species, including alligator lizards, fence lizards, and skinks, and thirteen snake species are known to occur in the park. Whiskeytown Lake and its tributaries also provide ideal habitats for the Western pond turtle--a federal species of concern.  Download Whiskeytown's reptile and amphibian list (pdf, 48K)
